SENT.plain: Anti-human immunoglobulin (Ig) antibodies with single-chain specificities induced Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) in various Burkitt lymphoma lines when the corresponding Ig chain was expressed on the cell surface
The F(ab')2 fragments of IgG antibody were as potent as intact Ig, while the Fab and Fc fragments gave no induction, indicating that cross-linking of surface Ig was required for the induction
Simultaneously with EBV induction, anti-Ig inhibited the uptake of 3H-thymidine
This inhibition was also seen in EBV-genome-negative Burkitt lymphoma lines
In contrast, no effect on virus induction and cell growth was noted in lymphoblastoid lines of non-neoplastic origin
The possible relationship between cell differentiation and latency of EBV-carrier state is discussed
